place.name: LLANAFAN FECHAN
place.gazetteerText: LLANAFAN-FECHAN, or LLANFECHAN, a parish in Builth district, Brecon; on the river Irvon, 5 miles W by S of Builth town and r. station. Post town, Builth, Breconshire. Acres, 2,783. Real property, £927. Pop., 163. Houses, 25. The surface is hilly, and the rocks include slate. Gwarafog, an ancient mansion, is now a farm-house. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Llanafan-Fawr, in the diocese of St. David's. The church is small. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
